content.description: Start low on the jug rail left of River Gritty, traverse up and right on good holds. Same top out as River Gritty
content.location: left side of Figurehead Wall

content.description: Start matched on the bottom lip of the roof. Traverse to the left, staying just over the lip of the roof using a sloper and a knobby crimp. Finish by grabbing the jug slot and standing up. The boulders underneath the roof are off. After the sloped jug of the first move, stay low and don't use the juggy top lip of the boulder - definitely an eliminate, but still decent.
content.protection: 2 pads (1 for the rock behind you) and a spotter
content.location: Obvious roof across the creek from the Scurvy boulder

content.description: Start as for Scurvy (sit start with right hand pinch and left hand sloper), making the same left slap for the sloper. Instead of continuing to the ledge, do a powerful move out right to a blocky jug and top out.
content.location: From the lake, head to the wooden bridge over the creek but don't cross it. Hike a couple minutes upstream; the Scurvy boulder is the first big climbable boulder you'll see in the stone slab/stream area.

content.description: See photo for the line. Match stand start on the minijug on the left, get your feet up a bit and fire that right hand over to the the nice jugs, work your hands up and finish on the top jug. Hoping to get out and clear some of the top off this winter to get a proper top out.
content.location: Middle of figurehead wall

content.description: Start on right side with feet on the block midway up from the ground. Hug the nice ledge until crack. Roll yourself over the edge to top out.
content.protection: 1 pad and spotter. have spotter drag pad to protect from the rock behind your back.
content.location: From perfect 0 boulder go right down the man made path until fork. Take left and you will see a big chunk of rock.

content.description: Sit start on downward/right facing corner. Paste that sticky rubber, work up, and show it you mean business.
content.protection: 1 pad. Smaller pads are better for this area.
content.location: Located on the far right of the Figurehead Wall.

content.description: Sit start low on the arête left of the Hoist the Mainsail crack. Climb the arête up and right to the scoop just right of the peak of the boulder.
content.location: The boulder is located on the large stone slab. It climbs the arête left of the finger sized crack.

content.description: Start as for Scurvy and follow it until you reach the rail. Instead of traversing left along the rail, do a big move straight up to grab the sloper lip and top out. About the same difficulty as Scurvy.
content.protection: 1 pad and a spotter (to keep you out of the creek)
content.location: Scurvy Boulder

content.description:
Sit start right hand on the honeycomb and left on sloping edge. Move up and left to the ledge and traverse it all the way left to the top out jug/flake. 

**Do not use the first jug/flake above the ledge, it will not hold.**
content.protection: At least 1 pad for the crux start and a spotter to keep you out of the creek.
content.location: The Scurvy Boulder is the most downstream boulder in the stone slab.

content.description: Stand start matched on right crimp rail. Work left then up through crimps to the topout.
content.protection: 2 pads. Smaller pads are best for this area.
content.location: Located in the middle of the Figurehead Wall.

content.description: Start low to the rightmost crimprail, stay low and work your way left to a large sidepull and climb up the corner. Top out at the jug the faces the bridge.
content.location: This is the first boulder you see on your way in from the trail.  It can be seen from the bridge.

content.description: Sit start on the arête on the boulder to the right of the Hoist the Mainsail crack in the gap between the boulders. Climb up and right not using the boulder to the Hoist boulder and mantle when you can go up no further. This is a little more awkward than the arête to the left but fun nonetheless.
content.location: The boulder is located on the large stone slab. It climbs the arête right of the finger sized crack on the boulder that is being leaned on.

content.description: Stand start with the cave undercling. Straight up through ledges. Just like your morning constitution, a warm up is always a good idea.
content.protection: 1 pad. Smaller pads are best for this area.
content.location: Located on the highly featured left side of the Figurehead Wall.

content.description: On the small crack that is to the right of "Children of The Corn"; start as low as you can. Easy climbing and a great warm-up.
content.location: On the same Boulder as "Children of the Corn"

content.description: This is a great boulder to practice your mantle skills. Stand start matched on the lip and find a way to wind up on top.
content.location: Located on the downstream face.

content.description: Sit start on crack behind lower jug on a slight overhang. Classic good holds many variations. Top out or match final hold.
content.location: Up the hill from Compress Me find the first overhang on the other side of a boulder. Sit start on the first jug/crack and follow the jugs left then straight up to a juggy finish, slopy top out. Uses a large slab for starting foot holds. Not the scramble up the rocks but past it.

content.description: Sit start. Either use those crack skills or layback and hoist that tub-o-lard  up the crack.
content.protection: At least 1 pad. Watch out for the ledge to the right.
content.location: Located on the big slab facing away from the creek.

content.description: Sit start on the bottom ledge with high feet. Work up the crack using whatever is within reach.
content.protection: At least 1 pad and a spotter
content.location: Located on the downstream face. Start in the hole on the gravel.

content.description: Sit start on the Scurvy boulder just right of the small boulder under the overhanging side. This is an unusual problem with the goal of staging a one-man mutiny from the Scurvy boulder over to Davie Jones' Locker and finish as for that problem. The small boulder is off.
content.location: Start on the Scurvy boulder with Davie Jones' Locker right behind you.

content.description: Start far left as you please and cruise through 2/3rds of the traverse. Bear down on the bear claw to get your feet settled on the bulge (big bottom ledge is off) before throwing to the arete. Finish up on Compress Me.
content.protection: At least one pad at the end.

content.description: Sit start on opposite arêtes, right hand on meaty chip and left hand low. Work to the lip and find your way out of that watery grave.
content.protection: At least 1 pad and a spotter.
content.location: Davie Jones' Locker can be found on the overhanging refrigerator sized block in the middle of the big slab.

content.description: Stand start in middle of face. Straight up and over the mini roof.
content.protection: At least 1 pad and a spotter.
content.location: The Crow's nest boulder is located just upstream of the lake on the left bank of Reedy Creek.

content.description: Start on the right of the big flake. Follow flake to the top.
content.location: Directly to the left of perfect 0.

content.description: Sit Start Right hand in obvious finger crack at the bottom and left hand on left facing side pull crimp. Use blocky feet to start. Shoot left hand up to a small but decent crimp and move right hand to right facing side pull crimp. Stem left foot out and rotate left hand to the left facing side of the crimp. Move right hand to gaston and lay back to the top out. easy top out, long hike down.
content.location: To the left of the arete, to the right of perfect 0.

content.description: Stand start for corona crimps. Right hand on right side pull, left on crimpier side pull slightly higher. Left foot up and push up to right Gaston, continue using side pulls to lip
content.location: Main wall at end of forest hill lake

content.description: Really fun and requires some technique. great warm-up! Use the arete and the sidepulls to the left. (Start on the arete, then work out left)
content.location: Located to the right of "The Perfect Zero".

content.description: Start on a good ledge and climb straight up the arete with some help from a sloper on the right face.  The giant ramp block is off but the smaller (ivy filled) block under the start hand is on.  An awkward sit start gets the same grade.
content.location: The arete to the left of Children of the Corn.

content.description: Start on the left of the obvious flake, follow left of flake to top out. Descent trail is back and to right of top out.
content.location: This is a new boulder in Forest Hill Park located near the lake accessed from the 42nd street parking area. Descend from parking area towards the lake, follow the path to the right as you get to the lake. The boulder is the obvious rock face before the path turns left and has a bridge on the left that brings you to the area where you will find crows nest.

content.description: Silly traverse. Start on the side facing the lake, make your way under and to the right side and traverse to the end of the rock. Mantle to top out.
content.protection: 2-3 small pads. wedge them in between the grass and the roots. hope they dont fall through.
content.location: Right in front of perfect 0 boulder.

content.description: Start as low as you can. Ian and I used a right hand crimp and a left hand on the rail waaay down low next to our heel. Grab the obvious left-hand jug, surf right, match, place a bomber heel, then mantel! Fun boulder, but short. Ideal spotting position is in the water, so bring some waders if you don't want to get wet!
content.location: Next to the small waterfall downcreek of River Gritty. Man-made landing of rocks should be obvious.

content.description: Not much to it. 1) Sit start, 2) Climb aboard.
content.protection: It's a tight squeeze, 1 pad will do.
content.location: Located facing away from the creek on the large slabby boulder near Man Overboard.

content.description: Start matched on the ridge of the bottom boulder that reminds you of a boats keel. Reach straight back to the face and top out.
content.protection: At least 2 pads (one just for the rock behind you) and a spotter.
content.location: Located across the creek from the big slab.

content.description:
The bouldering in Forest Hill Park is located in and around Reedy Creek, South/uphill of the lake. The most upstream area is the Figurehead Wall and the most downstream is the Crow's Nest boulder.   This area is very popular for families to walk and ride around the park, so be courteous and respectful to folks on the trails and pack out whatever you bring in. 

  Forest Hill Park is open from sunrise to sunset. Please be respectful of the park rules.
